timeline.bodyText: We can drop this entirely. If the list of allowed addresses is not empty, we use it. No need for this extra config. Move it to @DefunctConfig on the class.
timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: Let's make this cassandra.load-policy.allowed-addresses and name the field allowedAddresses
timeline.author: electrum
electrum
electrum

timeline.bodyText: How about inclusive. Then we don't need the "aka" in the comment above (which kind of indicates the field should be named better to be self-descriptive)
timeline.author: electrum
electrum

timeline.bodyText: Remove this along with removing the boolean property
timeline.author: electrum
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -137,9 +137,9 @@ Property Name                                                 Description
 ``cassandra.load-policy.shuffle-replicas``                    Set to ``true`` to use ``TokenAwarePolicy`` with shuffling of replicas,
                                                               defaults to ``false``.
 
-``cassandra.load-policy.use-white-list``                      Set to ``true`` to use ``WhiteListPolicy``, defaults to ``false``.
+``cassandra.load-policy.use-allow-list``                      Set to ``true`` to use ``AllowListPolicy``, defaults to ``false``.

timeline.bodyText:
The WhiteListPolicy is actually referring to the com.datastax.driver.core.policies.WhiteListPolicy class in the Cassandra driver. We can change the text to

Comma-separated list of hosts to allow.
timeline.author: electrum
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -137,9 +137,9 @@ Property Name                                                 Description
 ``cassandra.load-policy.shuffle-replicas``                    Set to ``true`` to use ``TokenAwarePolicy`` with shuffling of replicas,
                                                               defaults to ``false``.
 
-``cassandra.load-policy.use-white-list``                      Set to ``true`` to use ``WhiteListPolicy``, defaults to ``false``.
+``cassandra.load-policy.use-allow-list``                      Set to ``true`` to use ``AllowListPolicy``, defaults to ``false``.
 
-``cassandra.load-policy.white-list.addresses``                Comma-separated list of hosts for ``WhiteListPolicy``.
+``cassandra.load-policy.allow-list.addresses``                Comma-separated list of hosts for ``AllowListPolicy``.

timeline.bodyText:
We can simplify the entire item (and make it more correct since there other types of plugins)

Prevent plugis from seeing classes that are not part of the JDK (bootstrap classes) or the SPI.
timeline.author: electrum
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -151,7 +151,7 @@ SPI Changes
 * Make ``NodeManager`` specific to a connector instance.
 * Replace ``ConnectorFactoryContext`` with ``ConnectorContext``.
 * Use ``@SqlNullable`` for functions instead of ``@Nullable``.
-* Use a whitelist model for plugin class loading. This prevents connectors
+* Use an allow-list model for plugin class loading. This prevents connectors

timeline.bodyText:
This needs to be named getAllowedQueries so that it matches the setter, as config classes use JavaBean conventions and thus require matching names. It causes a test failure:
No getter for @Config method [public io.prestosql.verifier.VerifierConfig io.prestosql.verifier.VerifierConfig.setAllowedQueries(java.lang.String)].
timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: This is no longer used, so we can remove it (along with the getter/setter)
timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: Since we're getting rid of cassandra.load-policy.use-white-list, anyone using this feature will need to update their configs, so we can move this to @DefunctConfig as well (no need to retain it as legacy).
timeline.author: electrum
electrum
electrum
